meanings.definition: A person or thing that cooperates with or supplements the efforts of another.
meanings.sent1: In group projects, a synergist can help everyone work together smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The team player acted as a synergist, bringing unity to the group's actions.
meanings.sent3: The helpful robot was a synergist, making sure all the tasks were completed on time.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acted as a synergist, boosting morale and productivity.
meanings.sent5: The synergist in the office always found ways to make collaboration more efficient.

meanings.definition: A muscle that contracts with another muscle to produce movement.
meanings.sent1: The synergist muscle worked alongside the main muscle to lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent2: During exercise, the synergist muscles support the primary muscles in movement.
meanings.sent3: The little muscle played the role of a synergist, helping the big muscle lift weights.
meanings.sent4: Like a dance partner, the synergist muscle moved in harmony with the lead muscle.
meanings.sent5: The synergist muscle ensured smooth and coordinated movements during the workout.

meanings.definition: A substance that enhances the effectiveness of another substance.
meanings.sent1: Adding the synergist to the mixture improved its overall performance.
meanings.sent2: The chemical acted as a synergist, amplifying the effects of the main ingredient.
meanings.sent3: The secret ingredient acted as a synergist, making the dish taste even better.
meanings.sent4: The new additive functioned as a synergist, making the solution more potent.
meanings.sent5: The synergist substance boosted the power of the cleaning solution significantly.
